slug: /220
title: "This Week In React #220: Next.js, Astro, Nuqs, CRA, React Scan, Fumadocs, Fusion, Radix, Inertia | Sortables, Contributors Summit, Windows, Deep linking, Oklab, Audio, BottomTabs, Metro, OTA | TypeScript, Angular, Node.js, Vite"

date: 02-05-2025
---
This week we have a good variety of React articles and Next.js is finally adding support for Node.js runtime middleware!

segments.source_content: Mobile developers will also discover future plans for React Native, including desktop support from Microsoft. A new sortables drag & drop library should unlock new interactions in your app, considering it's quite hard to build all this yourself.

translations.fr: Les dÃ©veloppeurs mobiles dÃ©couvriront Ã©galement les futurs plans pour React Native, y compris le support desktop de Microsoft. Une nouvelle bibliothÃ¨que de glisser-dÃ©poser devrait dÃ©bloquer de nouvelles interactions dans vos applications, sachant qu'il est assez difficile de construire tout cela soi-mÃªme.

segments.source_content: TypeScript continues to progress with a new beta including a flag to support the newly added native Node.js support, and the upcoming browser support. A polyfill for native browser support is already available!

translations.fr: TypeScript continue de progresser avec une nouvelle bÃªta incluant un drapeau pour supporter le support natif Node.js rÃ©cemment ajoutÃ©, ainsi que le support navigateur Ã  venir. Un polyfill pour le support navigateur natif est dÃ©jÃ  disponible !
translations.en: TypeScript continue de progresser avec une nouvelle bÃªta incluant un drapeau pour supporter la prise en charge native rÃ©cemment ajoutÃ©e dans Node.js, et la future prise en charge navigateur. Un polyfill pour la prise en charge native navigateur est dÃ©jÃ  disponible !

translations.en: [![PR Next.js - Prise en charge du middleware Node.js](/emails/issues/220/nextjs-middleware.jpg)](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/pull/75624)
**[PR Next.js \- Prise en charge du middleware Node.js](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/pull/75624)**

segments.source_content: A much-awaited feature for the Next.js community. The latest v15.2 canary has a new `experimental.nodeMiddleware` flag letting you opt-in for `runtime: â€˜nodejsâ€™`, enabling you to use Node.js APIs in middleware, and remove the constraints of being limited to APIs compatible with the edge runtime.

fr.translation: Une fonctionnalitÃ© trÃ¨s attendue par la communautÃ© Next.js. La derniÃ¨re version v15.2 canary possÃ¨de un nouveau drapeau `experimental.nodeMiddleware` permettant d'opter pour `runtime: 'nodejs'`, vous autorisant Ã  utiliser les API Node.js dans les middlewares et Ã  lever les contraintes des API compatibles avec le runtime edge.
fr.reason: Content of a non-translatable 'inlineCode' element was changed. Source: '`runtime: â€˜nodejsâ€™`', Translation: '`runtime: 'nodejs'`'.

en.translation: Une fonctionnalitÃ© trÃ¨s attendue par la communautÃ© Next.js. La derniÃ¨re version canary v15.2 dispose d'un nouveau drapeau `experimental.nodeMiddleware` vous permettant d'opter pour `runtime: 'nodejs'`, autorisant ainsi l'utilisation des API Node.js dans le middleware et supprimant les contraintes liÃ©es aux API compatibles avec l'environnement d'exÃ©cution edge.
en.reason: Content of a non-translatable 'inlineCode' element was changed. Source: '`runtime: â€˜nodejsâ€™`', Translation: '`runtime: 'nodejs'`'.

segments.source_content: Vercel middleware has also been [rebuilt from the ground up](https://x.com/galstar/status/1886832573482934706) to support multiple runtimes and run on [Fluid compute](https://vercel.com/blog/introducing-fluid-compute), a new cost-efficient way for Vercel to run serverless functions.

translations.fr: Le middleware Vercel a Ã©galement Ã©tÃ© [reconstruit de fond en comble](https://x.com/galstar/status/1886832573482934706) pour supporter plusieurs runtimes et fonctionner sur [Fluid compute](https://vercel.com/blog/introducing-fluid-compute), une nouvelle mÃ©thode Ã©conomique pour Vercel d'exÃ©cuter des fonctions serverless.
translations.en: Le middleware Vercel a Ã©galement Ã©tÃ© [reconstruit de fond en comble](https://x.com/galstar/status/1886832573482934706) pour supporter plusieurs environnements d'exÃ©cution et fonctionner sur [Fluid compute](https://vercel.com/blog/introducing-fluid-compute), une nouvelle mÃ©thode Ã©conomique pour Vercel d'exÃ©cuter des fonctions serverless.

- ğŸ—“ï¸Â [Paris TypeScript La Conf'](https://la-conf.typescript.paris/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) -Â ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡·Â Paris - 28 FebruaryÂ - Last call to join the first ever TypeScript conference in the heart of Paris! Get 20% off tickets with code "TWIR"!
- ğŸ“– [Integrate Motion with Radix](https://motion.dev/docs/radix): New docs page presenting integration examples for exit and layout animations.
- ğŸ“œ [Single Responsibility Principle in React: The Art of Component Focus](https://cekrem.github.io/posts/single-responsibility-principle-in-react/): I agree with this practice of designing your React app in â€œlayersâ€.
- ğŸ“œ [Persisting Form Data in React: A Modern Approach with Nuqs](https://armand-salle.fr/post/persisting-form-data-in-react-a-modern-approach-with-nuqs/): Introduces a convenient lib to use search parameters in a typesafe way with integrations for Next.js and React Router.
- ğŸ“œ [Using Phoenix with React and Inertia](https://dnlytras.com/blog/phoenix-react-inertia): Explains the surprising technical choice of combining an Elixir/Phoenix backend with a React SPA, including the challenges encountered and caveats. The Inertia protocol permits stitching both technologies through an adapter.

segments.source_content: A new powerful React Native library for re-ordering items with drag & drop gestures, including features such as:

segments.source_content:
- Support for Grid and Flex layouts
- Support for different item sizes, spacing, and arrangements
- Auto-scrolling when dragging outside screen
- Seamless layout animations
- Simple API, full TypeScript support
- Compatible with Expo and both architectures

translations.fr:
- Prise en charge des dispositions en grille et flexbox
- Prise en charge de diffÃ©rentes tailles d'Ã©lÃ©ments, espacements et arrangements
- DÃ©filement automatique lors du glissement en dehors de l'Ã©cran
- Animations de disposition fluides

- Compatible avec Expo et les deux architectures

- Prise en charge des dispositions Grid et Flex

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ“œ [You should not use URLPattern to route HTTP requests on the server](https://adventures.nodeland.dev/archive/you-should-not-use-urlpattern-to-route-http/): The upcoming Node.js 23 URLPattern feature, based on regexp, is not scalable enough.
- ğŸ“œ [From Rust to TypeScript: A New Chapter for Prisma ORM](https://www.prisma.io/blog/from-rust-to-typescript-a-new-chapter-for-prisma-orm)
- ğŸ“¦ [TypeScript 5.8 beta \- `erasableSyntaxOnly`, require(esm), dependent return type narrowing](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/typescript/announcing-typescript-5-8-beta/)
- ğŸ“¦ [ES Module Shims 2.0 \- Polyfill for native ES module features](https://guybedford.com/es-module-shims-2.0): Already supports TC39 Type Annotations stripping, letting you run TypeScript code with `erasableSyntaxOnly` natively in the browser today, similar to Node.js\!
- ğŸ“¦ [Vite 6.1](https://github.com/vitejs/vite/blob/main/packages/vite/CHANGELOG.md#610-2025-02-05)
- ğŸ“¦ [Mentoss \- fetch() mocker for server/browser runtimes](https://humanwhocodes.com/blog/2025/01/introducing-mentoss-fetch-mocker/)
- ğŸ¥ [Angular: The Documentary](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cRC9DlH45lA)
